page.title: 11ST. MARY'S CHURCH NORTHOLT
page.content: Situated on an ancient mound, in a conservation area, stands the Parish Church of St. Mary's Northolt. Looking out from the church one can see the{Race Course Estate}and Central London. Serving an urban parish of 40,000 people it acts as 'an oasis of peace in a jungle of noise'. Due to increasing{vandalism}and break-ins the church now remains locked. This was not the case 20 years ago. The congregation is drawn from Northolt and Southall and{attendance}at all but Evensong is increasing. The average attendance for Morning Service is between 12 - 20 and for Family Eucharist 100, with between 50 - 60 communicants. There has been Christian Worship at St. Mary's for over 700 years, and it is expected that this will continue into the future.
